golden_diagnosis: 尼曼匹克病B型/Niemann-Pick disease type B; NPD-B/Chronic visceral acid sphingomyelinase deficiency/Niemann-pick disease, type B,尼曼匹克病B型/Niemann-Pick disease type B; NPD-B/Chronic visceral acid sphingomyelinase deficiency/Niemann-pick disease, type B,尼曼匹克病B型/Niemann-Pick disease type B; NPD-B/Chronic visceral acid sphingomyelinase deficiency/Niemann-pick disease, type B,尼曼匹克病C型/Niemann-Pick disease type C; NPD-C/Niemann-Pick disease type C/Niemann-pick disease, type C1,尼曼匹克病C型/Niemann-Pick disease type C; NPD-C/Niemann-Pick disease type C/Niemann-pick disease, type C1,尼曼匹克病C型/Niemann-Pick disease type C; NPD-C/Niemann-Pick disease type C/Niemann-pick disease, type C1,Niemann-pick disease, type C2,尼曼匹克病A型/Niemann-Pick disease type A; NPD-A/Niemann-Pick disease, type A,尼曼匹克病A型/Niemann-Pick disease type A; NPD-A/Niemann-Pick disease, type A
predict_diagnosis:
1. Multiple myeloma: a disease characterized by the buildup of abnormal plasma cells in the bone marrow, leading to a range of symptoms and complications.
2. Castleman disease: a rare disease that occurs when large lymph nodes (lymphomas) expand in various parts of the body, including the lungs and abdomen.
3. Hemosiderinuria: a rare genetic disorder that affects the absorption and storage of iron in the body, leading to iron overload and a range of related symptoms and complications.
4. Hemolytic uremic syndrome: a disease characterized by recurrent episodes of renal failure, hemolytic anemia, and thrombotic complications, often associated with an infection such as E. coli and Shiga toxin.
5. Amyloidosis: a rare disease that occurs when abnormal proteins accumulate in the body's tissues, leading to a range of symptoms and complications.
6. Nephrolithiasis: the formation of kidney stones, which can cause a range of symptoms including pain, nausea, vomiting, and renal insufficiency.
7. Hemolytic and uremic syndrome: a rare disease characterized by episodes of renal failure, hemolytic anemia, and thrombotic complications, often associated with an infection, such as Escherichia coli and Shiga toxin.
8. Kidney infections: infections of the kidneys, known as pyelonephritis or acute glomerulonephritis, that can be caused by bacteria or viruses and can lead to a range of symptoms including pain, nausea, vomiting, and hematuria.
9. Lupus nephritis: a complication of systemic lupus erythematosus that affects the kidneys and can cause symptoms such as hematuria, proteinuria, hypertension, and renal failure.
10. Prostate cancer: a common cancer in men that affects the prostate gland, which secretes fluid that makes up semen, and can cause symptoms such as urinary frequency, urgency, and discomfort, and may also affect the bones.
